channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: £551m extra funding for NHS and social care
item.description: The money is being allocated for ongoing costs and tackling waiting times.

item.title: Climate change: Families in Wales urged to plant more trees
item.description: Wales' deputy climate change minister admits "we're way behind" tree-planting targets.

item.title: Bridgend: Mother charged with murder of son, 2
item.description: Reid Steele died in hospital after being found in a critical condition at a house in Bridgend.

item.title: Hell's Mouth: Man drowned after saving friend's daughter
item.description: Stephen Hulsmeier was unresponsive when he was brought ashore, an inquest hears.

item.title: Merthyr Tydfil: Valium leaves one dead and another in hospital
item.description: Another person required hospital treatment after taking the prescription drug.

item.title: Porthcawl dementia patient missing for 30 hours found in ditch
item.description: Joseph Hughes was found by an off-duty officer named Amy after going missing from his care home.

item.title: Plaid Cymru: Ex-leader no longer friends with successor
item.description: Leanne Wood says Adam Price made "a bad judgement call" in the timing of his leadership challenge.

item.title: Covid: All 16 and 17-year-olds in Wales to get jab offer
item.description: Anyone who has not yet taken up the offer of a vaccine is encouraged to do so.

item.title: Man in court over alleged racist and anti-Semitic podcasts
item.description: James Allchurch pleads not guilty to distributing recordings intending to stir up racial hated.

item.title: Man who died after Glynneath waterfall difficulties named
item.description: Hemanta Kumar Rai, 28, had been at the fall with friends and died at the scene.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban must not be treated as pariahs, says Lord Hain
item.description: Countries must incentivise the new rulers not to return to "bad old ways", says Lord Hain.

item.title: Porthcawl: Off-duty police officer found missing man in ditch
item.description: PC Amy Rowlands found the dementia patient 30 hours after he was reported missing.

item.title: Plaid's ex-leader has not been friends with successor for years
item.description: Leanne Wood says she thinks Adam Price went about his Plaid leadership challenge the wrong way.

item.title: Afghanistan: Activists call for Wales to take more refugees
item.description: Campaigners take to the streets of Cardiff to welcome Afghan refugees to the Welsh capital.

item.title: Afghanistan: Man who fled Taliban fears for family
item.description: Mohammed has not been able to contact his relatives since the Taliban seized control of Afghanistan.

item.title: Stonehenge: Welsh links 'damaged' by tourists
item.description: A recent BBC documentary attracted more visitors to the ancient monuments, a national park says.

item.title: Who erected Wrexham's new giant Hollywood-style sign?
item.description: A large Hollywood-style sign has appeared in Wrexham, and no one knows who put it there.

item.title: Glenn Phillips is the star as Welsh Fire win final group game against London Spirit
item.description: Welsh Fire end their men's Hundred campaign on a high by beating London Spirit in Cardiff in a gripping final game of the group stages.

item.title: Sorba Thomas: Wales boss Robert Page monitors Huddersfield winger
item.description: Wales manager Rob Page is monitoring the form of Huddersfield Town winger Sorba Thomas after confirming his eligibility.

item.title: The Hundred: London Spirit beat Welsh Fire but miss out on top-three finish
item.description: London Spirit beat Welsh Fire in the final group game of the women's Hundred in Cardiff, but miss out on reaching the latter stages of the competition.

item.title: One-Day Cup: Unchanged Glamorgan bid for first final glory
item.description: Glamorgan will choose from an unchanged squad as they bid for their first ever limited-overs final win in Thursday's One-Day Cup climax against Durham.

item.title: Women's Champions League: Swansea City lose opener 4-1 to CSKA Moscow in extra time
item.description: Swansea City Ladies lose a thrilling Champions League first-round game against CSKA Moscow 4-1 after extra time.

item.title: Aelod blaenllaw'n galw am newid arweinydd Plaid Cymru
item.description: Cyn-Gomisiynydd Heddlu a Throsedd Plaid Cymru'n dweud ei bod yn "amser newid arweinydd" y blaid.

item.title: Cyhuddo dynes o lofruddio ei mab ym Mhen-y-bont
item.description: Bu farw Reid Steele yn dilyn digwyddiad yn ardal Broadlands y dref ar 11 Awst.

item.title: Afghanistan: 'Angen gweithredu nawr' ar ailgartrefu pobl
item.description: Galw ar Lywodraeth y DU i weithredu'n gyflym i roi lloches i bobl sy'n ffoi o Afghanistan.

item.title: Uchafbwyntiau cwarantîn Gwenno Rees
item.description: Bu'n rhaid i Gwenno hunan-ynysu mewn gwesty yn Llundain ar ôl teithio adref o Tanzania.

item.title: Sut y daeth sêr Hollywood yn berchnogion Wrecsam
item.description: Yr hanes y tu ôl i Ryan Reynolds a Rob McElhenney yn prynu clwb pêl-droed hynaf Cymru.
